issue.title: cmake error
issue.body:
<!--- If you are reporting a security issue, please email security@cloudcompare.org directly -->

cmake --build . error as follows 
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/qCC/ccGraphicalTransformationTool.h:24:0,
                 from /mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/qCC/ccGraphicalTransformationTool.cpp:18:
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/build/qCC/ui_graphicalTransformationDlg.h: In member function ‘void Ui_GraphicalTransformationDlg::setupUi(QDialog*)’:
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/build/qCC/ui_graphicalTransformationDlg.h:322:29: error: ‘class QDoubleSpinBox’ has no member named ‘setStepType’; did you mean ‘setStyle’?
         incrementalRotSpin->setStepType(QAbstractSpinBox::AdaptiveDecimalStepType);
                             ^~~~~~~~~~~
                             setStyle
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/build/qCC/ui_graphicalTransformationDlg.h:322:59: error: ‘AdaptiveDecimalStepType’ is not a member of ‘QAbstractSpinBox’
         incrementalRotSpin->setStepType(QAbstractSpinBox::AdaptiveDecimalStepType);
                                                           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/build/qCC/ui_graphicalTransformationDlg.h:344:31: error: ‘class QDoubleSpinBox’ has no member named ‘setStepType’; did you mean ‘setStyle’?
         incrementalTransSpin->setStepType(QAbstractSpinBox::AdaptiveDecimalStepType);
                               ^~~~~~~~~~~
                               setStyle
/mnt/d/project/github/CloudCompare/build/qCC/ui_graphicalTransformationDlg.h:344:61: error: ‘AdaptiveDecimalStepType’ is not a member of ‘QAbstractSpinBox’
         incrementalTransSpin->setStepType(QAbstractSpinBox::AdaptiveDecimalStepType);
                                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
qCC/CMakeFiles/CloudCompare.dir/build.make:1336: recipe for target 'qCC/CMakeFiles/CloudCompare.dir/ccGraphicalTransformationTool.cpp.o' failed
make[2]: *** [qCC/CMakeFiles/CloudCompare.dir/ccGraphicalTransformationTool.cpp.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2617: recipe for target 'qCC/CMakeFiles/CloudCompare.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [qCC/CMakeFiles/CloudCompare.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:129: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2



**Your environment**
 - CC Version (or git hash/tag):
 - wsl ubuntu18.04  :
 - Graphics card:  
 - Qt Version (if compiling): 
<!--- Include any other relevant details about your environment -->

comment.body: Hi. It seems you are using a too old version on QT. You need at least qt 5.12. Unfortunatly it's not available in ubuntu 18.04 package repository. You can still download QT 5.15 from the website, compile it from source, get it from a PPA or a conda env.

commits.message:
Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure (#1872)

* Update qMeshBoolean.cpp

* Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure

pull_request.title: Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure
pull_request.body: After the qMeshBoolean plugin compilation failure (see #1871), i changed the mesh_boolean.h path position in qMeshBolean.cpp and then the compilation finished without errors, CloudCompare works. It was hidden by ifdef-endif code part.

pull_request.title: Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure
pull_request.body: After the qMeshBoolean plugin compilation failure (see #1871), i changed the mesh_boolean.h path position in qMeshBolean.cpp and then the compilation finished without errors, CloudCompare works. It was hidden by ifdef-endif code part.

issue.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
issue.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

commits.message:
Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption (#1874)

* New option for the command line "SF_ADD_ID" to add point indexes as an SF.

* new option -SF_ADD_ID -AS_INT to store the indexes as integer values not converted to floats to avoid loss of resolution for large indexes

* Update CHANGELOG.md

* Update ccEntityAction.cpp

* Take care of endianness

pull_request.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
pull_request.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

pull_request.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
pull_request.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

pull_request.title: Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure
pull_request.body: After the qMeshBoolean plugin compilation failure (see #1871), i changed the mesh_boolean.h path position in qMeshBolean.cpp and then the compilation finished without errors, CloudCompare works. It was hidden by ifdef-endif code part.

comment.body: To respect the spirit of the warnings disabling lines below, you should move the #include AFTER the #ifdef _MSC_VER section (otherwise the #pragma warning calls will be useless).

pull_request.title: Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure
pull_request.body: After the qMeshBoolean plugin compilation failure (see #1871), i changed the mesh_boolean.h path position in qMeshBolean.cpp and then the compilation finished without errors, CloudCompare works. It was hidden by ifdef-endif code part.

pull_request.title: Updated qMeshBoolean.cpp to prevent compilation failure
pull_request.body: After the qMeshBoolean plugin compilation failure (see #1871), i changed the mesh_boolean.h path position in qMeshBolean.cpp and then the compilation finished without errors, CloudCompare works. It was hidden by ifdef-endif code part.

issue.title: Mainwindow lag problems
issue.body:
Hi again. After been manged to compile CloudCompare with most of plugins available, also with @tmontaigu 's python plugin and 3DFin in Ubuntu 22.04, i encountered lags in mainwindow when i use it. For example: when i move a points cloud, the pivot remain and i've to refresh the viewer (zoom in or zoom out) to make it disappear; the pivot is set to visible with rotation only (see image). 

![Screenshot](https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare/assets/117673134/3ceb9216-7995-4a48-aeca-6facea3dfa16)

Even when i toggle files in db tree, when i scroll in the console or in properties window, i've to refresh the viewer because these actions described don’t work immediately but there are lags.
I encountered this problem both after CloudCompare compilation and with the installation of flatpak package shared by @rjanvier [here](https://github.com/CloudCompare/org.cloudcompare.CloudCompare/releases).
It isn't a problem of my PC because the windows installer of last beta release that i used to install CloudCompare in Windows 11 doesn't have these lag problems.

comment.body: My PC is a Dell Inspiron 5510, a laptop with Intel core i7 11th generation and integrated gpu Intel Iris Xe. I haven't a dedicated gpu such as Nvidia

comment.body: Ok thanks a lot for the debuging, so it's also related to the "unified" rendering. what kind of GPU are you using. if you use a nvidia one are you using `Nouveau` or the closed source driver?

issue.title: Mainwindow lag problems
issue.body:
Hi again. After been manged to compile CloudCompare with most of plugins available, also with @tmontaigu 's python plugin and 3DFin in Ubuntu 22.04, i encountered lags in mainwindow when i use it. For example: when i move a points cloud, the pivot remain and i've to refresh the viewer (zoom in or zoom out) to make it disappear; the pivot is set to visible with rotation only (see image). 

![Screenshot](https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare/assets/117673134/3ceb9216-7995-4a48-aeca-6facea3dfa16)

Even when i toggle files in db tree, when i scroll in the console or in properties window, i've to refresh the viewer because these actions described don’t work immediately but there are lags.
I encountered this problem both after CloudCompare compilation and with the installation of flatpak package shared by @rjanvier [here](https://github.com/CloudCompare/org.cloudcompare.CloudCompare/releases).
It isn't a problem of my PC because the windows installer of last beta release that i used to install CloudCompare in Windows 11 doesn't have these lag problems.

comment.body: So, the situation is this: i compiled CC from source code at this commit [`1d5f74e`](https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare/commit/1d5f74ee1c18027abff10824210d922f7a9f84a0) without any plugin and there aren't lag problems. I also compiled CC from last master branch (that one for which i opened this issue) without any plugin and there are the lag problems described above. So the problem isn't due by CC plugins.

comment.body:
@rjanvier i'll compile that revision of CC and i hope we'll find the problem.
@tmontaigu probably it isn't python plugin, i compiled CC also without it and the lags there are still.

comment.body: Hi, it seems there are some issue with rendering under linux. (I'm not impacted on my side). see https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare/issues/1867. Could you please compile this specific revision of CC https://github.com/CloudCompare/CloudCompare/commit/1d5f74ee1c18027abff10824210d922f7a9f84a0 (without any plugin) and tell us if the issue remains?

issue.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
issue.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

comment.body: Ok understood. I don't compile it myself, but I know some people do...

issue.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
issue.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

comment.body:
My use case is the following: 

- I use CloudCompare in command line to extract points in a laz file (with waveforms as wdp) which are close to a another classified point cloud.
- In this selection, for each point, I want to go back to the original las file and get all echoes belonging to the same laser pulse (I do that in Python). As there is a loss of accuracy when recording the GPS time, I have found this index trick to be able to go back in the original file, get the GPS time at full resolution, and so get all other echoes belonging to the same shot, if any.
- You are right that this "index" should not be used for display in CC

Big endianness should be handled properly, you are right. Do you compile CC for big endian architectures?

issue.title: Cmd option SF_ADD_ID with AS_INT supboption
issue.body:
SF_ADD_ID allows to add the index of each point as a scalar field, initially as a float 32.
Possibility to store the index as a raw int32 to avoid a loss of accuracy for large integers and store values from 0 up to 2**32.

comment.body: What is the exact use case of this export as an int? (as it will give strange results within CloudCompare). I am mostly wondering about systems with big endianness. Should it be properly handled here?
